intro: Eriogonum elatum subsp. typicum, commonly known as the tall buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces fluffy, seed-bearing bracts that give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
